title: Acts 1:1
content: 1 I made the first account, O Theophilus, about all that Jesus began both to do and to teach,

title: Acts 1:2
content: 2 until that day when he was taken up, having given commands through the Holy Spirit to the apostles whom he had chosen,

title: Acts 1:3
content: 3 to whom also, after he had suffered, he presented himself living with many proofs, appearing to them for 40 days and speaking things concerning the kingdom of God.

title: Acts 1:4
content: 4 And meeting together with them, he commanded them not to depart from Jerusalem, but to await the promise of the Father, “which you heard from me,

title: Acts 1:5
content: 5 that John indeed baptized with water, but you will be baptized in the Holy Spirit after these not many days.”

title: Acts 1:6
content: 6 They therefore having assembled, they were asking him, saying, “Lord, if you are restoring the kingdom to Israel at this time?”

title: Acts 1:7
content: 7 But he said to them, “It is not for you to know the times or the seasons that the Father has set by his own authority.

title: Acts 1:8
content: 8 But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you, and you will be my witnesses both in Jerusalem and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the end of the earth.”

title: Acts 1:9
content: 9 And having said these things, as they were looking, he was raised up, and a cloud hid him from their eyes.

title: Acts 1:10
content: 10 And while they were looking intently into heaven as he was going up, and behold, two men stood by them in white clothes.

title: Acts 1:11
content: 11 And they said, “Men, Galileans, why do you stand looking into heaven? This Jesus, the one having been taken up from you into heaven, thus will come, the way you saw him going into heaven.”

title: Acts 1:12
content: 12 Then they returned to Jerusalem from the hill that is called Olivet, which is near Jerusalem, having a journey of a Sabbath.

title: Acts 1:13
content: 13 And when they arrived, they went up into the upper chamber where they were staying, both Peter and John, and James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James of Alphaeus and Simon the Zealot, and Judas of James.

title: Acts 1:14
content: 14 They all were continuing unanimously in prayer, with the women and Mary the mother of Jesus and with his brothers.

title: Acts 1:15
content: 15 And in those days Peter, having stood up in the midst of the brothers, said (and the multitude of names to the same was about 120),

title: Acts 1:16
content: 16 “Men, brothers, it was necessary for the scripture to be fulfilled that the Holy Spirit spoke before by the mouth of David concerning Judas, the one having become a guide to the ones arresting Jesus.

title: Acts 1:17
content: 17 For he was numbered with us and received a share of this ministry.”

title: Acts 1:18
content: 18 (Now indeed this one bought a field from the wage of unrighteousness, and having fallen headfirst, he burst open in the middle, and all his entrails were poured out.

title: Acts 1:19
content: 19 And it became known to all those living in Jerusalem. Therefore that field was called in their own language Akeldama, that is, Field of Blood.)

title: Acts 1:20
content: 20 “For it is written in the book of Psalms, ‘Let his habitation become desolate, and let not one dwelling be in it,’ and ‘Let another take his overseership.’

title: Acts 1:21
content: 21 Therefore it is necessary, of the men having accompanied us during all the time in which the Lord Jesus came in and went out among us,

title: Acts 1:22
content: 22 beginning from the baptism of John until the day on which he was taken up from us—one of these {is} to become a witness with us of his resurrection.”

title: Acts 1:23
content: 23 And they stood up two, Joseph, called Barsabbas, who was named Justus, and Matthias.

title: Acts 1:24
content: 24 And praying, they said, “You, Lord, heart-knower of all, show which one from these two you have chosen

title: Acts 1:25
content: 25 to take this place of ministry and apostleship from which Judas turned aside to go to his own place.”

title: Acts 1:26
content: 26 And they cast lots for them, and the lot fell to Matthias, and he was chosen together with the 11 apostles.

title: Acts 2:1
content: 1 And when the day of Pentecost was completely filled, they were all together to the same.

title: Acts 2:2
content: 2 And suddenly a sound came from heaven, as of a strong wind being borne along, and it filled the whole house where they were sitting.

title: Acts 2:3
content: 3 And tongues as if of fire appeared to them, distributing themselves, and they sat upon each one of them.

title: Acts 2:4
content: 4 And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and they began to speak in other languages, as the Spirit was giving them to speak out.

title: Acts 2:5
content: 5 Now there were Jews living in Jerusalem, godly men, from every nation of those under heaven.

title: Acts 2:6
content: 6 And when this sound happened, the multitude came together and was confused, because each one was hearing them speaking in his own language.

title: Acts 2:7
content: 7 And they were all amazed and were marveling, saying, “Behold, are not all these who are speaking Galileans?

title: Acts 2:8
content: 8 And how are we hearing, each in our own language in which we were born?

title: Acts 2:9
content: 9 Parthians and Medes and Elamites, and those inhabiting Mesopotamia, Judea and also Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,

title: Acts 2:10
content: 10 Phrygia and also Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of Libya that {are} near Cyrene, and Romans visiting,

title: Acts 2:11
content: 11 both Jews and proselytes, Cretans and Arabians, we are hearing them speaking in our languages the great things of God.”

title: Acts 2:12
content: 12 So they were all amazed and were perplexed, saying one to another, “What does this want to be?”

title: Acts 2:13
content: 13 But others, mocking, were saying, “They are filled with sweet wine.”

title: Acts 2:14
content: 14 But Peter, having stood with the eleven, raised up his voice and spoke out to them, “Men, Jews, and all the ones inhabiting Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and take my words into your ears.

title: Acts 2:15
content: 15 For these are not drunk as you are assuming, for it is the third hour of the day.

title: Acts 2:16
content: 16 But this is what was spoken through the prophet Joel:

title: Acts 2:17
content: 17 ‘“And it will be in the last days,” God says, “I will pour out from my Spirit on all flesh, and your sons and your daughters will prophesy and your young men will see visions and your old men will dream dreams.

title: Acts 2:18
content: 18 And even on my male servants and on my female servants in those days I will pour out from my Spirit, and they will prophesy.

title: Acts 2:19
content: 19 And I will give wonders in the heaven above and signs on the earth below, blood and fire and vapor of smoke.

title: Acts 2:20
content: 20 The sun will be turned to darkness, and the moon to blood before the great and remarkable day of the Lord comes.

title: Acts 2:21
content: 21 And it will be, everyone who may call on the name of the Lord will be saved.”’

title: Acts 2:22
content: 22 Men, Israelites, hear these words: Jesus the Nazarene {was} a man attested to you by God with mighty works and wonders and signs that God did through him in the midst of you, as you yourselves know.

title: Acts 2:23
content: 23 This one, given up by the determined counsel and foreknowledge of God, you killed by the hand of the lawless, having fastened,

title: Acts 2:24
content: 24 whom God raised up, having loosed the agonies of death, because it was not possible for him to be held by it.

title: Acts 2:25
content: 25 For David says about him, ‘I saw the Lord before me through all, for he is at my right so that I should not be moved.

title: Acts 2:26
content: 26 Because of this, my heart was glad and my tongue exulted. And indeed, my flesh will also dwell in hope.

title: Acts 2:27
content: 27 For you will not abandon my soul to Hades, nor will you allow your Holy One to see decay.

title: Acts 2:28
content: 28 You made known to me the paths of life; you will fill me with gladness with your face.’

title: Acts 2:29
content: 29 Men, brothers, it is possible to speak with confidence to you about the patriarch David, that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.

title: Acts 2:30
content: 30 Therefore, being a prophet and having known that God had sworn to him with an oath to set from the fruit of his loins upon his throne,

title: Acts 2:31
content: 31 having foreseen this, he spoke about the resurrection of the Christ, that neither was he abandoned to Hades, nor did his flesh see decay.

title: Acts 2:32
content: 32 This Jesus, God has raised up, of which we all are witnesses.

title: Acts 2:33
content: 33 Therefore, having been exalted to the right of God and having received the promise of the Holy Spirit from the Father, he has poured out this which you both see and hear.

title: Acts 2:34
content: 34 For David did not ascend to the heavens, but he himself says, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right

title: Acts 2:35
content: 35 until I make your enemies a stool for your feet.”’

title: Acts 2:36
content: 36 Therefore, let all the house of Israel know certainly that God has made him both Lord and Christ, this Jesus whom you crucified.”

title: Acts 2:37
content: 37 And hearing this they were pierced in the heart, and they said to Peter and the rest of the apostles, “Men, brothers, what should we do?”

title: Acts 2:38
content: 38 Then Peter said to them, “Repent and each of you be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

title: Acts 2:39
content: 39 For the promise is to you and to your children and to all those {being} at a distance, as many as the Lord our God may call.”

title: Acts 2:40
content: 40 And with many other words he testified and urged them, saying, “Be saved from this perverse generation.”

title: Acts 2:41
content: 41 Therefore, having received his word, they were baptized, and about 3,000 souls were added in that day.

title: Acts 2:42
content: 42 And they were continuing in the teaching of the apostles and in fellowship, in the breaking of bread and in prayers.

title: Acts 2:43
content: 43 And fear was coming on every soul, and many wonders and signs were happening through the apostles.

title: Acts 2:44
content: 44 And all those believing were to the same and had all things in common,

title: Acts 2:45
content: 45 and they were selling properties and possessions and they were distributing them to all, as anyone might have need

title: Acts 2:46
content: 46 and, continuing unanimously every day in the temple and breaking bread in each house, they were sharing food with exultation and sincerity of heart,

title: Acts 2:47
content: 47 praising God and having favor with the whole people, and each day the Lord was adding the ones being saved to the same.

title: Acts 3:1
content: 1 Now Peter and John were going up to the temple at the hour of prayer, the ninth hour.

title: Acts 3:2
content: 2 And a certain man, being lame from the womb of his mother, was being carried, whom each day they placed at the gate of the temple that is called Beautiful to ask for alms from those going into the temple,

title: Acts 3:3
content: 3 who, seeing Peter and John being about to enter into the temple, asked to receive alms.

title: Acts 3:4
content: 4 But Peter, looking intently at him with John, said, “Look at us.”

title: Acts 3:5
content: 5 So he paid attention to them, expecting to receive something from them.

title: Acts 3:6
content: 6 But Peter said, “Silver and gold I do not possess, but what I have, this I give to you. In the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene, walk.”

title: Acts 3:7
content: 7 And seizing him by the right hand, he raised him up, and immediately his feet and ankles were made strong.

title: Acts 3:8
content: 8 And leaping up, he stood and began to walk, and he entered with them into the temple, walking and leaping and praising God.

title: Acts 3:9
content: 9 And all the people saw him walking and praising God.

title: Acts 3:10
content: 10 And they recognized him, that he was the one sitting for alms at the Beautiful Gate of the temple, and they were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.

title: Acts 3:11
content: 11 And as he was holding Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the porch that is called Solomon’s, marveling.

title: Acts 3:12
content: 12 But Peter, seeing this, replied to the people, “Men, Israelites, why do you marvel at this? Or why do you look intently at us, as if we have made him to walk by our own power or godliness?

title: Acts 3:13
content: 13 The God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his Servant Jesus, whom you indeed delivered up and rejected before the face of Pilate, when that one had decided to release him.

title: Acts 3:14
content: 14 But you rejected the Holy and Righteous One, and asked for a man, a murderer, to be granted to you,

title: Acts 3:15
content: 15 and you killed the Originator of Life, whom God raised from the dead, of which we are witnesses.

title: Acts 3:16
content: 16 And by faith in his name, this one whom you see and know, his name has made strong. And the faith that {is} through him has given to him this complete health in the presence of all of you.

title: Acts 3:17
content: 17 And now, brothers, I know that you acted in ignorance, as also your rulers.

title: Acts 3:18
content: 18 But what God foretold through the mouth of all the prophets, that his Christ would suffer, he has fulfilled thus.

title: Acts 3:19
content: 19 Repent, therefore, and turn back for your sins to be wiped away,

title: Acts 3:20
content: 20 so that times of refreshment may come from the face of the Lord and he may send the one appointed for you, Christ Jesus,

title: Acts 3:21
content: 21 whom it is necessary for heaven to receive until the times of the restoration of all things, about which God spoke from the age through the mouth of his holy prophets.

title: Acts 3:22
content: 22 Moses indeed said, ‘The Lord our God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your brothers. You will listen to him according to everything—whatever he may speak to you.

title: Acts 3:23
content: 23 But it will be that every soul that does not listen to that prophet will be destroyed from the people.’

title: Acts 3:24
content: 24 And indeed, all the prophets from Samuel and those after him, as many as have spoken, have also announced these days.

title: Acts 3:25
content: 25 You are the sons of the prophets and of the covenant that God made with your fathers, saying to Abraham, ‘And in your seed will all the families of the earth be blessed.’

title: Acts 3:26
content: 26 God, having raised up his Servant, sent him to you first, blessing you by turning each of you from your wickedness.”

title: Acts 4:1
content: 1 And as they were speaking to the people, the priests and the captain of the temple and the Sadducees came up to them,

title: Acts 4:2
content: 2 greatly troubled because they were teaching the people and proclaiming in Jesus the resurrection that {is} from the dead.

title: Acts 4:3
content: 3 And they laid hands on them and put them in custody until the next day, since it was already evening.

title: Acts 4:4
content: 4 But many of the ones having heard the word believed, and the number of the men became about 5, 000.

title: Acts 4:5
content: 5 And it happened that on the next day their rulers and elders and scribes were gathered together in Jerusalem,

title: Acts 4:6
content: 6 and Annas the high priest, and Caiaphas, and John, and Alexander, and as many as were from the high priestly family.

title: Acts 4:7
content: 7 And having set them in {their} midst, they asked them, “By what power or in what name have you done this?”

title: Acts 4:8
content: 8 Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, “Rulers of the people and elders,

title: Acts 4:9
content: 9 if we are being questioned today concerning a good deed to a sick man, by what means he was made well,

title: Acts 4:10
content: 10 let it be known to you all and to all the people of Israel that in the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead, by this one this {man} stands before you healthy.

title: Acts 4:11
content: 11 He is the stone that was rejected by you, the builders, which has become the head of the corner.

title: Acts 4:12
content: 12 And there is no salvation in anyone else, for there is no other name under heaven given among men by which we must be saved.”

title: Acts 4:13
content: 13 And seeing the boldness of Peter and John, and realizing that they were uneducated and ordinary men, they marveled, and they recognized them, that they had been with Jesus.

title: Acts 4:14
content: 14 But seeing the man who had been healed standing with them, they had nothing to say in opposition.

title: Acts 4:15
content: 15 But having commanded them to go outside the Sanhedrin, they conferred among themselves,

title: Acts 4:16
content: 16 saying, “What should we do to these men? For it is evident to everyone living in Jerusalem that a notable sign has happened through them, and we are not able to deny it.

title: Acts 4:17
content: 17 But so that it may not be spread unto more among the people, let us warn them no longer to speak in this name to any of men.”

title: Acts 4:18
content: 18 And summoning them, they commanded them neither to speak nor to teach at all in the name of Jesus.

title: Acts 4:19
content: 19 But answering, Peter and John said to them, “Whether it is right before God to listen to you rather than to God, you judge.

title: Acts 4:20
content: 20 For we are not able not to speak what we have seen and heard.”

title: Acts 4:21
content: 21 So, having warned them further, they released them, finding nothing for which they might punish them, on account of the people, for they were all glorifying God for what had happened.

title: Acts 4:22
content: 22 For the man to whom this sign of healing had happened was more than 40 years old.

title: Acts 4:23
content: 23 But having been released, they came to {their} own people and reported all that the chief priests and the elders had said to them.

title: Acts 4:24
content: 24 And having heard, they raised their voice unanimously to God and said, “Lord, you {are} the one having made the heaven and the earth and the sea and all that {is} in them,

title: Acts 4:25
content: 25 the one having said by the Holy Spirit from the mouth of our father David, your servant, ‘Why did the nations rage, and the peoples imagine useless things?

title: Acts 4:26
content: 26 The kings of the earth took their stand and the rulers were gathered to the same against the Lord and against his Christ.’

title: Acts 4:27
content: 27 For in truth both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with the nations and the people of Israel, were gathered together in this city against your holy Servant Jesus, whom you anointed,

title: Acts 4:28
content: 28 to do all that your hand and your counsel had predetermined to happen.

title: Acts 4:29
content: 29 And now, Lord, look upon their threats and grant to your servants to speak your word with all boldness

title: Acts 4:30
content: 30 as you stretch out your hand to heal and for signs and wonders to happen through the name of your holy Servant Jesus.”

title: Acts 4:31
content: 31 And when they had prayed, the place in which they were gathered together was shaken, and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and they were speaking the word of God with boldness.

title: Acts 4:32
content: 32 Now the multitude of the ones having believed was one in heart and soul. And not one said that any of the things that were to him was his own, but everything was common to them.

title: Acts 4:33
content: 33 And with great power the apostles were proclaiming the testimony of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus, and great grace was upon them all.

title: Acts 4:34
content: 34 For there was not anyone needy among them, for as many as were owners of lands or houses, selling them, were bringing the price of the things being sold

title: Acts 4:35
content: 35 and they were laying it at the feet of the apostles, and it was being distributed to each one, according as anyone had need.

title: Acts 4:36
content: 36 Then Joseph, called Barnabas by the apostles (which, being translated, is Son of Encouragement), a Levite from Cyprus by birth,

title: Acts 4:37
content: 37 selling a field that was to him, brought the money and laid it at the feet of the apostles.

title: Acts 5:1
content: 1 Now a certain man, Ananias by name, with Sapphira his wife, sold a piece of land,

title: Acts 5:2
content: 2 and he kept back from the price, {his} wife also knowing, and bringing a certain portion, he laid it at the feet of the apostles.

title: Acts 5:3
content: 3 But Peter said, “Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart for you to lie to the Holy Spirit and to keep back from the price of the land?

title: Acts 5:4
content: 4 While it remained, did it not remain yours, and being sold, was it {not} in your authority? How {is it} that you placed this thing in your heart? You have not lied to men, but to God.”

title: Acts 5:5
content: 5 And hearing these words, Ananias, falling down, expired, and great fear came upon all the ones having heard.

title: Acts 5:6
content: 6 So rising up, the young men wrapped him up and, carrying him out, they buried him.

title: Acts 5:7
content: 7 And an interval of about three hours happened, and his wife, not knowing what had happened, came in.

title: Acts 5:8
content: 8 And Peter said to her, “Tell me whether you sold the land for so much.” And she said, “Yes, for so much.”

title: Acts 5:9
content: 9 So Peter said to her, “How {is it} that it was agreed together by you to test the Spirit of the Lord? Behold, the feet of the ones having buried your husband {are} at the door, and they will carry you out.”

title: Acts 5:10
content: 10 And immediately she fell down at his feet and expired. And having come in, the young men found her dead, and carrying her out, they buried her beside her husband.

title: Acts 5:11
content: 11 And great fear came upon the whole church and upon all the ones hearing these things.

title: Acts 5:12
content: 12 And many signs and wonders were happening through the hands of the apostles among the people, and they were all unanimously at the Porch of Solomon.

title: Acts 5:13
content: 13 But none of the others dared to join them; however, the people extolled them.

title: Acts 5:14
content: 14 And more believers were being added to the Lord, multitudes of both men and of women,

title: Acts 5:15
content: 15 so that they even carried the sick into the streets and laid them on cots and mats, so that as Peter came by, at least {his} shadow might overshadow any one of them.

title: Acts 5:16
content: 16 And a multitude also came together from the towns around Jerusalem, bringing the sick and those afflicted by unclean spirits, who were all healed.

title: Acts 5:17
content: 17 But rising up, the high priest and all those with him (which is the sect of the Sadducees) were filled with jealousy,

title: Acts 5:18
content: 18 and they laid hands on the apostles and put them in the public prison.

title: Acts 5:19
content: 19 But during the night an angel of the Lord opened the doors of the prison, bringing them out, and said,

title: Acts 5:20
content: 20 “Go and, standing in the temple, speak to the people all the words of this life.”

title: Acts 5:21
content: 21 And having heard this, they entered into the temple about daybreak and were teaching. And having arrived, the high priest and those with him called together the Sanhedrin, even all the elders of the sons of Israel, and sent to the prison to bring the apostles.

title: Acts 5:22
content: 22 But having arrived, the officers did not find them in the prison, so having returned, they reported,

title: Acts 5:23
content: 23 saying, “We found the prison shut in all security and the guards standing at the doors, but having opened, we found no one inside.”

title: Acts 5:24
content: 24 And when both the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these words, they were perplexed concerning them, as to what this might become.

title: Acts 5:25
content: 25 Then someone, having arrived, reported to them, “Behold, the men whom you put in the prison are standing in the temple and teaching the people.”

title: Acts 5:26
content: 26 Then the captain, going with the officers, brought them back, not with violence, for they feared the people, lest they stone them.

title: Acts 5:27
content: 27 And having brought them, they set them in the Sanhedrin, and the high priest interrogated them,

title: Acts 5:28
content: 28 saying, “We commanded you with a command not to teach in this name, and behold, you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and you desire to bring upon us the blood of this man.”

title: Acts 5:29
content: 29 But answering, Peter and the apostles said, “It is necessary to obey God rather than men.

title: Acts 5:30
content: 30 The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom you killed, having hung him on a tree.

title: Acts 5:31
content: 31 God has exalted this one to his right as Prince and Savior, to give repentance and forgiveness of sins to Israel.

title: Acts 5:32
content: 32 And we are witnesses of these things, and the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those obeying him.”

title: Acts 5:33
content: 33 But having heard this, they were furious and wanted to kill them.

title: Acts 5:34
content: 34 But a certain Pharisee, Gamaliel by name, a law teacher, honored by all the people, rising up in the Sanhedrin, commanded to put the apostles outside for a little.

title: Acts 5:35
content: 35 And he said to them, “Men, Israelites, pay attention to yourselves, what you are about to do to these men.

title: Acts 5:36
content: 36 For before these days, Theudas rose up, saying himself to be somebody, to whom was joined a number of men, about 400, who was killed, and all, as many as were persuaded by him, were dispersed, and they came to nothing.

title: Acts 5:37
content: 37 After this one, Judas the Galilean rose up in the days of the census and drew away people after him. That one also perished, and all, as many as were persuaded by him, were scattered.

title: Acts 5:38
content: 38 And now I say these things to you: Keep away from these men and release them, for if this counsel or this work is from men, it will be destroyed,

title: Acts 5:39
content: 39 but if it is from God, you will not be able to destroy them, lest you may even be found God-opposers.” And they were persuaded by him.

title: Acts 5:40
content: 40 And summoning the apostles, having beaten them, they commanded them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and they released them.

title: Acts 5:41
content: 41 Therefore, they indeed were going out from the face of the Sanhedrin rejoicing that they had been considered worthy to suffer dishonor for the Name.

title: Acts 5:42
content: 42 And every day, in the temple and in each house, they did not cease teaching and proclaiming the gospel—Jesus {is} the Christ.

title: Acts 6:1
content: 1 Now in those days, when the disciples were multiplying, a complaint by the Hellenists happened against the Hebrews, because their widows were being overlooked in the daily serving.

title: Acts 6:2
content: 2 So summoning the multitude of the disciples, the Twelve said, “It is not acceptable for us to leave behind the word of God to serve tables.

title: Acts 6:3
content: 3 So brothers, choose from among yourselves seven men of good reputation, full of the Spirit and of wisdom, whom we may appoint over this task.

title: Acts 6:4
content: 4 But we will continue in prayer and in the ministry of the word.”

title: Acts 6:5
content: 5 And the statement was pleasing before the whole multitude. So they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolaus, a proselyte from Antioch.

title: Acts 6:6
content: 6 They brought them before the apostles, and having prayed, they placed their hands upon them.

title: Acts 6:7
content: 7 So the word of God kept spreading, and the number of disciples in Jerusalem increased greatly, and a large crowd of the priests became obedient to the faith.

title: Acts 6:8
content: 8 Now Stephen, full of grace and power, was doing great wonders and signs among the people.

title: Acts 6:9
content: 9 But there arose some people, the ones from the synagogue that is called Freedmen, and of the Cyrenians, and of the Alexandrians, and of those from Cilicia and Asia. They were debating with Stephen.

title: Acts 6:10
content: 10 But they were not able to stand against the wisdom and the Spirit by whom he spoke.

title: Acts 6:11
content: 11 Then they bribed men to say, “We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and God.”

title: Acts 6:12
content: 12 They also stirred up the people and the elders and the scribes, and approaching him, they seized him and brought him to the Sanhedrin.

title: Acts 6:13
content: 13 And they brought false witnesses, saying, “This man does not stop speaking words against the holy place and the law.

title: Acts 6:14
content: 14 For we have heard him say that this Jesus the Nazarene will destroy this place and change the customs that Moses handed down to us.”

content: 47 “No one is able to withhold water, is he, so that these are not baptized who have received the Holy Spirit as we also {did}?”

title: Acts 10:48
content: 48 And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked him to stay for several days.

title: Acts 11:1
content: 1 Now the apostles and the brothers being throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.

title: Acts 11:2
content: 2 And when Peter came up to Jerusalem, those from the circumcision were disputing with him,

title: Acts 11:3
content: 3 saying that he went in to men having foreskins and ate with them.

title: Acts 11:4
content: 4 But Peter, beginning, was explaining to them in order, saying,

title: Acts 11:5
content: 5 “I was praying in the city of Joppa, and in a trance I saw a vision of a certain container coming down, like a large sheet being let down from the sky by {its} four corners, and it came unto me,

title: Acts 11:6
content: 6 gazing into which I was looking closely and I saw the four-legged animals of the earth, and the wild beasts, and the creeping animals, and the birds of the sky.

title: Acts 11:7
content: 7 Then I also heard a voice saying to me, ‘Peter, arising, kill and eat!’

title: Acts 11:8
content: 8 But I said, ‘By no means, Lord; for the common or unclean has never entered into my mouth.’

title: Acts 11:9
content: 9 But the voice answered for a second {time} from heaven, ‘What God has cleansed, you, do not make common!’

title: Acts 11:10
content: 10 And this happened three times, and everything was pulled up to the sky again.

title: Acts 11:11
content: 11 And behold, immediately three men stood at the house in which we were, having been sent from Caesarea to me.

title: Acts 11:12
content: 12 And the Spirit said to me to go with them, not hesitating. And these six brothers also went with me, and we entered into the house of the man.

title: Acts 11:13
content: 13 Then he reported to us how he had seen the angel standing in his house and saying, ‘Send to Joppa and summon Simon, called Peter.

title: Acts 11:14
content: 14 He will speak words to you by which you will be saved—you and all your house.’

title: Acts 11:15
content: 15 But as I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell on them, just as also on us in the beginning.

title: Acts 11:16
content: 16 Then I remembered the word of the Lord, how he was saying, ‘John indeed baptized with water; but you will be baptized in the Holy Spirit.’

title: Acts 11:17
content: 17 If, therefore, God gave to them the same gift as also to us having believed on the Lord Jesus Christ, I, who was I {to be} able to hinder God?”

title: Acts 11:18
content: 18 And having heard these things, they became quiet and glorified God, saying, “Then to the Gentiles also God has given repentance unto life.”

title: Acts 11:19
content: 19 Then indeed the ones having been scattered from the persecution having happened over Stephen spread to Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch, speaking the word to no one except only to Jews.

title: Acts 11:20
content: 20 But some of them were men, Cypriots and Cyrenians, who, having come to Antioch, were speaking also to the Greeks, proclaiming the Lord Jesus.

title: Acts 11:21
content: 21 And the hand of the Lord was with them; and a great number, believing, turned to the Lord.

title: Acts 11:22
content: 22 And the report about them came to the ears of the church that was in Jerusalem, and they sent out Barnabas as far as Antioch,

title: Acts 11:23
content: 23 who, having come and having seen the grace of God, rejoiced and was encouraging {them} all to remain with the Lord with purpose of heart.

title: Acts 11:24
content: 24 For he was a good man and full of the Holy Spirit and of faith, and a considerable crowd was added to the Lord.

title: Acts 11:25
content: 25 And he went out to Tarsus to search for Saul.

title: Acts 11:26
content: 26 And having found him, he brought him to Antioch. And it happened to them that for even a whole year they were gathered together with the church and taught a considerable crowd. And the disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.

title: Acts 11:27
content: 27 Now in these days prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.

title: Acts 11:28
content: 28 And one of them, Agabus by name, having arisen, signified through the Spirit {that} a great famine was about to occur over the whole world. This happened upon Claudius.

title: Acts 11:29
content: 29 So they determined, just as any of the disciples was prospering, each of them to send {something} for assistance to the brothers living in Judea,

title: Acts 11:30
content: 30 which indeed they did, sending it to the elders by the hand of Barnabas and Saul.

title: Acts 12:1
content: 1 Now at that time Herod the king laid on hands to harm some from the church.

title: Acts 12:2
content: 2 And he killed James, the brother of John, with the sword.

title: Acts 12:3
content: 3 And seeing that this was pleasing to the Jews, he proceeded to arrest Peter also (and those were the days of Unleavened Bread),

title: Acts 12:4
content: 4 and whom, having arrested, he put in prison, handing him over to four quaternions of soldiers to guard him, intending to bring him out to the people after the Passover.

title: Acts 12:5
content: 5 So indeed Peter was being kept in the prison, but prayer was being made earnestly to God for him by the church.

title: Acts 12:6
content: 6 And when Herod was going to bring him out, that night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains, and guards before the door were watching the prison.

title: Acts 12:7
content: 7 And behold, an angel of the Lord stood by him, and a light shone in the prison cell. And striking the side of Peter, he awakened him, saying, “Get up in haste,” and his chains fell away from {his} hands.

title: Acts 12:8
content: 8 And the angel said to him, “Gird yourself and tie on your sandals.” So he did thus. And he said to him, “Put on your outer garment and follow me.”

title: Acts 12:9
content: 9 And going out, he followed him, but he did not know that what was being done by the angel was real, but he was thinking he was seeing a vision.

title: Acts 12:10
content: 10 But having passed by the first guard and the second, they came to the iron gate leading into the city, which opened for them by itself. And having gone out, they went down one street, and suddenly the angel went away from him.

title: Acts 12:11
content: 11 And Peter, having come to himself, said, “Now I truly know that the Lord sent out his angel and delivered me from the hand of Herod and all the expectation of the Jewish people.”

title: Acts 12:12
content: 12 And having realized this, he went to the house of Mary, the mother of John, called Mark, where many were gathered together and praying.

title: Acts 12:13
content: 13 And when he knocked at the door of the gate, a servant girl, Rhoda by name, came to answer.

title: Acts 12:14
content: 14 And having recognized the voice of Peter, from joy she did not open the gate, but running inside, she reported, “Peter is standing at the gate!”

title: Acts 12:15
content: 15 But they said to her, “You are insane!” But she was insisting that it was thus. So they were saying, “It is his angel.”

title: Acts 12:16
content: 16 But Peter was continuing knocking, and opening, they saw him and marveled.

title: Acts 12:17
content: 17 And having motioned to them with {his} hand to be silent, he described how the Lord had led him out from the prison. And he said, “Report these things to James and the brothers.” And having gone out, he went to another place.

title: Acts 12:18
content: 18 Now when day had come, there was no small disturbance among the soldiers, what then had Peter become.

title: Acts 12:19
content: 19 And Herod, having searched for him and not having found him, having questioned the guards, ordered them to be put to death. And having gone down from Judea to Caesarea, he was staying there.

title: Acts 12:20
content: 20 Now he was quarreling with the Tyrians and Sidonians. So they came to him unanimously, and having persuaded Blastus, the one over the bedchamber of the king, they were requesting peace, because their country was nourished from the king’s country.

title: Acts 12:21
content: 21 And on the appointed day, Herod, having put on royal clothing and having sat on the throne, made a speech to them.

title: Acts 12:22
content: 22 And the people were shouting, “The voice of a god and not of a man!”

title: Acts 12:23
content: 23 And immediately an angel of the Lord struck him because he did not give the glory to God, and having become worm-eaten, he died.

title: Acts 12:24
content: 24 But the word of God was increasing and was being multiplied.

title: Acts 12:25
content: 25 Then Barnabas and Saul returned to Jerusalem, having completed their service, bringing with them John, called Mark.

title: Acts 13:1
content: 1 Now in Antioch, in the church being {there}, were prophets and teachers: both Barnabas and Simeon called Niger, and Lucius the Cyrenian; both Manaen, the foster brother of Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.

title: Acts 13:2
content: 2 And while they were ministering to the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Separate, then, Barnabas and Saul to me for the work to which I have called them.”

title: Acts 13:3
content: 3 Then, having fasted and prayed, and having laid {their} hands on them, they released them.

title: Acts 13:4
content: 4 So they, having been sent out by the Holy Spirit, went down to Seleucia; and from there they sailed away to Cyprus.

title: Acts 13:5
content: 5 And having arrived in Salamis, they were proclaiming the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews. And they also had John as an assistant.

title: Acts 13:6
content: 6 And having passed through the whole island as far as Paphos, they found a certain man, a magician, a Jewish false prophet, whose name {was} Bar Jesus,

title: Acts 13:7
content: 7 who was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus—an intelligent man. Summoning Barnabas and Saul, he sought to hear the word of God.

title: Acts 13:8
content: 8 But Elymas, “the Magician” (for thus is his name translated), opposed them, seeking to turn the proconsul away from the faith.

title: Acts 13:9
content: 9 But Saul, also Paul, being filled with the Holy Spirit, staring at him intently,

title: Acts 13:10
content: 10 said, “O full of all deceit and all trickery, son of the devil, enemy of all righteousness, will you not stop turning aside the straight paths of the Lord?

title: Acts 13:11
content: 11 And now, behold, the hand of the Lord {is} upon you, and you will be blind, not seeing the sun for a time.” And immediately a mist and darkness fell upon him, and going around, he was seeking someone to lead him by the hand.

title: Acts 13:12
content: 12 Then the proconsul, having seen the {thing} having happened, believed, being astonished at the teaching of the Lord.

title: Acts 13:13
content: 13 Now having put to sea from Paphos, the ones around Paul came to Perga of Pamphylia. But John, withdrawing from them, returned to Jerusalem.

title: Acts 13:14
content: 14 But they, passing through from Perga, came to Antioch of Pisidia and, going into the synagogue on the day of the Sabbath, they sat down.

title: Acts 13:15
content: 15 And after the reading of the Law and the Prophets, the synagogue leaders sent to them, saying, “Men, brothers, if any word of exhortation for the people is in you, speak.”

title: Acts 13:16
content: 16 So Paul, arising and motioning with {his} hand, said, “Men, Israelites and ones fearing God, listen.

title: Acts 13:17
content: 17 The God of this people Israel chose our fathers and exalted the people when they sojourned in the land of Egypt, and with an uplifted arm he led them out of it.

title: Acts 13:18
content: 18 And for about a 40-year time, he endured them in the wilderness.

title: Acts 13:19
content: 19 And having destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, he gave them their land for an inheritance,

title: Acts 13:20
content: 20 in about 450 years. And after these things, he gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.

title: Acts 13:21
content: 21 And then they requested a king, and God gave them Saul, son of Kish, a man from the tribe of Benjamin, for 40 years.

title: Acts 13:22
content: 22 And having removed him, he raised up David for them for {their} king, about whom also he said, testifying, ‘I have found David, {son} of Jesse, a man according to my heart, who will do all my will.’

title: Acts 13:23
content: 23 From the seed of this one, according to promise, God brought to Israel a Savior, Jesus,

title: Acts 13:24
content: 24 John having announced beforehand, before the face of his entrance, a baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.

title: Acts 13:25
content: 25 And as John was completing {his} course, he was saying, ‘Who do you think me to be? I am not he. But behold, one is coming after me, of whom the sandals of {his} feet I am not worthy to untie.’

title: Acts 13:26
content: 26 Men, brothers, sons of the family of Abraham, and the ones among you fearing God, to us the word of this salvation has been sent.

title: Acts 13:27
content: 27 For the ones living in Jerusalem and their rulers, not recognizing this one and condemning him, fulfilled the voices of the prophets being read on every Sabbath.

title: Acts 13:28
content: 28 And finding no reason for death, they asked Pilate for him to be killed.

title: Acts 13:29
content: 29 And when they had completed all the things having been written about him, taking him down from the tree, they laid him in a tomb.

title: Acts 13:30
content: 30 But God raised him from the dead,

title: Acts 13:31
content: 31 who was seen for many days by the ones having come up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who now are his witnesses to the people.

title: Acts 13:32
content: 32 And we are proclaiming to you the promise having been to {our} fathers,

title: Acts 13:33
content: 33 that God has completely fulfilled this for our children, raising up Jesus. As it is also written in the second Psalm: ‘You are my Son; today I have fathered you.’

title: Acts 13:34
content: 34 And that he raised him up from the dead, never going to return to decay, he has spoken thus: ‘I will give you the holy, trustworthy things of David.’

title: Acts 13:35
content: 35 For in another {place} he also says: ‘You will not allow your Holy One to see decay.’

title: Acts 13:36
content: 36 For indeed David, having served the counsel of God in his own generation, fell asleep and was laid with his fathers and saw decay.

title: Acts 13:37
content: 37 But he whom God raised up did not see decay.

title: Acts 13:38
content: 38 So let it be known to you, men, brothers, that through this one release of sins is proclaimed to you and from everything of which you were not able to be justified in the law of Moses.

title: Acts 13:39
content: 39 In this one, everyone believing is justified.

title: Acts 13:40
content: 40 Look, therefore that the thing spoken about in the prophets may not come upon you:

title: Acts 13:41
content: 41 ‘Look, you despisers, and marvel and be destroyed! For I am doing a work in your days, a work that you would not believe at all, even if someone announced it to you.’”

title: Acts 13:42
content: 42 And as they were leaving, they were begging these words to be spoken to them on the next Sabbath.

title: Acts 13:43
content: 43 And when the synagogue meeting was ended, many of the Jews and the worshiping proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas, who, speaking to them, urged them to continue in the grace of God.

title: Acts 13:44
content: 44 And on the next Sabbath, almost the whole city was gathered together to hear the word of the Lord.

title: Acts 13:45
content: 45 But seeing the crowds, the Jews were filled with jealousy, and they were speaking against the things being said by Paul, blaspheming.

title: Acts 13:46
content: 46 And Paul and Barnabas, speaking boldly, said, “It was necessary for the word of God to be spoken to you first. Since you reject it and judge yourselves not worthy of eternal life, behold, we are turning to the Gentiles.

title: Acts 13:47
content: 47 For thus the Lord has commanded us: ‘I have placed you as a light for the Gentiles, for you to be for salvation as far as the end of the earth.’”

title: Acts 13:48
content: 48 But hearing this, the Gentiles were rejoicing and glorifying the word of the Lord, and as many as were appointed to eternal life believed.

title: Acts 13:49
content: 49 And the word of the Lord was being spread throughout the whole region.

title: Acts 13:50
content: 50 But the Jews stirred up the influential worshiping women and the principal ones of the city and aroused a persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and they threw them out from their boundaries.

title: Acts 13:51
content: 51 But they, having shaken off the dust of {their} feet against them, went to Iconium.

title: Acts 13:52
content: 52 But the disciples were filled with joy and the Holy Spirit.

title: Acts 14:1
content: 1 And it happened that in Iconium they entered together into the synagogue of the Jews and spoke in such a way that a great multitude, both of Jews and of Greeks, believed.

title: Acts 14:2
content: 2 But the disobeying Jews stirred up and embittered the souls of the Gentiles against the brothers.

title: Acts 14:3
content: 3 But indeed they stayed there for a long time, speaking boldly for the Lord, who was testifying to the word of his grace by granting signs and wonders to happen by their hands.

title: Acts 14:4
content: 4 But the multitude of the city was divided, and some indeed were with the Jews, but some with the apostles.

title: Acts 14:5
content: 5 But when a plot happened of both the Gentiles and the Jews, with their rulers, to mistreat and stone them,

title: Acts 14:6
content: 6 having become aware of it, they fled to the cities of Lycaonia, Lystra and Derbe, and the surrounding region,

title: Acts 14:7
content: 7 and there they were proclaiming the gospel.

title: Acts 14:8
content: 8 And in Lystra a certain man was sitting, powerless in {his} feet, lame from the womb of his mother, who had never walked.

title: Acts 14:9
content: 9 He heard Paul speaking, who looked intently at him and saw that he had faith to be healed.

title: Acts 14:10
content: 10 He said in a loud voice, “Stand upright on your feet,” and he jumped up and walked around.

title: Acts 14:11
content: 11 And the crowds, seeing what Paul had done, raised their voice, saying in Lycaonian, “The gods, having been made like men, have come down to us.”

title: Acts 14:12
content: 12 And they were calling Barnabas “Zeus,” and Paul “Hermes,” because he was the leader of the word.

title: Acts 14:13
content: 13 And the priest of Zeus, being before the city, bringing oxen and wreaths to the gates, was wanting to sacrifice with the crowds.

title: Acts 14:14
content: 14 But hearing this, the apostles Barnabas and Paul, tearing their clothing, rushed out into the crowd, crying out

title: Acts 14:15
content: 15 and saying, “Men, why are you doing these things? We also are men, like-passioned to you. We are proclaiming the gospel to you to turn you from these useless things to the living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and everything in them,

title: Acts 14:16
content: 16 who in bygone generations allowed all the nations to go their own ways,

title: Acts 14:17
content: 17 and yet he did not leave himself without witness: doing good, giving you rains from the sky and fruitful seasons, filling your hearts with food and gladness.”

title: Acts 14:18
content: 18 And saying these things they barely restrained the crowds, so that they did not sacrifice to them.

title: Acts 14:19
content: 19 But Jews from Antioch and Iconium came and, having persuaded the crowds and having stoned Paul, they were dragging him out of the city, thinking him to have died.

title: Acts 14:20
content: 20 But as the disciples surrounded him, arising, he entered into the city, and the next day he went with Barnabas to Derbe.

title: Acts 14:21
content: 21 And having proclaimed the gospel in that city and having made many disciples, they returned to Lystra and to Iconium and Antioch,

title: Acts 14:22
content: 22 strengthening the souls of the disciples, encouraging them to continue in the faith, and {saying}, “It is necessary for us to enter into the kingdom of God through many afflictions.”

title: Acts 14:23
content: 23 And having appointed elders for them by church, having prayed with fasting, they entrusted them to the Lord in whom they had believed.

title: Acts 14:24
content: 24 And having passed through Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.

title: Acts 14:25
content: 25 And having spoken the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia.

title: Acts 14:26
content: 26 And from there they sailed to Antioch, where they had been commended to the grace of God for the work which they had completed.

title: Acts 14:27
content: 27 And having arrived and having gathered the church together, they were reporting how much God had done with them and that he had opened a door of faith for the Gentiles.

title: Acts 14:28
content: 28 And they were staying for not a little time with the disciples.

title: Acts 15:1
content: 1 And certain ones coming down from Judea were teaching the brothers, “Unless you are circumcised in the custom of Moses, you are not able to be saved.”

title: Acts 15:2
content: 2 And no little dispute and debate by Paul and Barnabas with them having happened, they appointed Paul and Barnabas and certain others from among them to go up to the apostles and elders in Jerusalem about this question.

title: Acts 15:3
content: 3 Therefore indeed the ones having been sent out by the church were passing through both Phoenicia and Samaria, describing the conversion of the Gentiles and producing great joy in all the brothers,

title: Acts 15:4
content: 4 And having arrived in Jerusalem, they were welcomed by the church and the apostles and the elders, and they reported how much God had done with them.

title: Acts 15:5
content: 5 But certain ones from the sect of the Pharisees, having believed, stood up, saying, “It is necessary to circumcise them and command them to keep the law of Moses.”

title: Acts 15:6
content: 6 So the apostles and the elders were gathered together to see about this word.

title: Acts 15:7
content: 7 And much debate having happened, Peter, arising, said to them, “Men, brothers, you know that from original days God chose among you: By my mouth the Gentiles would hear the word of the gospel and believe.

title: Acts 15:8
content: 8 And God, the heart-knower, testified to them, giving them the Holy Spirit, just as also to us;

title: Acts 15:9
content: 9 and he did not distinguish between us and them, having cleansed their hearts by faith.

title: Acts 15:10
content: 10 Now, therefore, why are you testing God, putting a yoke upon the neck of the disciples that neither our fathers nor we have been able to bear?

title: Acts 15:11
content: 11 But we believe ourselves to be saved through the grace of the Lord Jesus, according to the way they also.”

title: Acts 15:12
content: 12 And the whole crowd kept silent and was listening to Barnabas and Paul describing how many signs and wonders God had worked among the Gentiles through them.

title: Acts 15:13
content: 13 And after they stopped speaking, James answered, saying, “Men, brothers, listen to me.

title: Acts 15:14
content: 14 Simeon has described how God first looked to take from the Gentiles a people for his name.

title: Acts 15:15
content: 15 And with this the words of the prophets agree, as it is written,

title: Acts 15:16
content: 16 ‘After these things I will return, and I will rebuild the fallen tent of David, and I will rebuild its ruins and restore it,

title: Acts 15:17
content: 17 so that the remnant of men may seek the Lord, even all the Gentiles upon whom my name has been called upon them, says the Lord doing these things

title: Acts 15:18
content: 18 known from eternity.’

title: Acts 15:19
content: 19 Therefore, I judge not to trouble the ones from the Gentiles turning to God,

title: Acts 15:20
content: 20 but to write to them to abstain from the pollution of idols and sexual immorality and the strangled and blood.

title: Acts 15:21
content: 21 For Moses has by city, from ancient generations, ones proclaiming him, being read in the synagogues on every Sabbath.”

title: Acts 15:22
content: 22 Then it seemed good to the apostles and the elders, with the whole church, to send to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas chosen men from among them—Judas called Barsabbas, and Silas, leading men among the brothers—

title: Acts 15:23
content: 23 writing by their hand: “The apostles and the elders, brothers, to the brothers among the Gentiles throughout Antioch and Syria and Cilicia: Greetings!

title: Acts 15:24
content: 24 Now we have heard that some, having gone out from us, have disturbed you with words, upsetting your souls, whom we did not commission;

title: Acts 15:25
content: 25 it seemed good to us, having become unanimous, having chosen men, to send them to you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,

title: Acts 15:26
content: 26 men having handed over their souls for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

title: Acts 15:27
content: 27 Therefore we have sent Judas and Silas, they also reporting the same thing by word.

title: Acts 15:28
content: 28 For it seemed good to the Holy Spirit and to us for no greater burden to be laid upon you than these necessary things:

title: Acts 15:29
content: 29 to abstain from things sacrificed to idols and blood and the strangled and sexual immorality, from which keeping yourselves, you will do well. Farewell.”

title: Acts 15:30
content: 30 So they, having been dismissed, indeed came down to Antioch, and gathering the crowd together, they delivered the letter.

title: Acts 15:31
content: 31 And having read it, they rejoiced at the encouragement.

title: Acts 15:32
content: 32 Both Judas and Silas, also being prophets themselves, encouraged the brothers with many a word and strengthened them.

title: Acts 15:33
content: 33 And having stayed some time, they were sent away with peace from the brothers to the ones having sent them.

title: Acts 15:34
content: 34 [But it seemed good to Silas for them to remain there, so only Judas traveled.]

title: Acts 15:35
content: 35 But Paul and Barnabas were staying in Antioch, teaching and proclaiming the word of the Lord, with many others also.

title: Acts 15:36
content: 36 Then after some days, Paul said to Barnabas, “Returning, then, let us visit the brothers in every city in which we proclaimed the word of the Lord, how they are.”

title: Acts 15:37
content: 37 But Barnabas was wanting also to take with them John called Mark.

title: Acts 15:38
content: 38 But Paul was thinking it wise not to take with them this one having withdrawn from them in Pamphylia and not having accompanied them in the work.

title: Acts 15:39
content: 39 And a dispute happened, so as for them to be separated from each other and for Barnabas, taking Mark with him, to sail away to Cyprus.

title: Acts 15:40
content: 40 But Paul, having chosen Silas, went out, having been commended by the brothers to the grace of the Lord.

title: Acts 15:41
content: 41 And he was going through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the churches.

title: Acts 16:1
content: 1 And he also came down to Derbe and to Lystra, and behold, a certain disciple was there, Timothy by name, the son of a believing Jewish woman but of a father, a Greek,

title: Acts 16:2
content: 2 who was being well attested by the brothers in Lystra and Iconium.

title: Acts 16:3
content: 3 Paul wanted this one to go out with him and, taking him, he circumcised him because of the Jews being in those places, for they all knew that his father was a Greek.

title: Acts 16:4
content: 4 And as they were going through the cities, they were delivering to them to keep the decrees that had been decided by the apostles and elders in Jerusalem.

title: Acts 16:5
content: 5 So indeed the churches were being strengthened in the faith and were increasing in number each day.

title: Acts 16:6
content: 6 And they went through Phrygia and the Galatian region, having been forbidden by the Holy Spirit to speak the word in Asia.

title: Acts 16:7
content: 7 And having come near Mysia, they were attempting to go into Bithynia, but the Spirit of Jesus did not permit them.

title: Acts 16:8
content: 8 So passing by Mysia, they came down to Troas.

title: Acts 16:9
content: 9 And a vision appeared to Paul by night: A man, a certain Macedonian, was standing and calling him and saying, “Coming over into Macedonia, help us.”

title: Acts 16:10
content: 10 So when he had seen the vision, immediately we sought to go out into Macedonia, reasoning together that God had summoned us to proclaim the gospel to them.

title: Acts 16:11
content: 11 So setting sail from Troas, we made a straight course to Samothrace, and the next day to Neapolis,

title: Acts 16:12
content: 12 and from there to Philippi, which is the first city in the district of Macedonia, a colony, and we were staying in this city for some days.

title: Acts 16:13
content: 13 And on the day of the Sabbath, we went outside the gate by a river, where we thought a place of prayer to be. And having sat down, we spoke to the women having come together.

title: Acts 16:14
content: 14 And a certain woman, Lydia by name, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, worshiping God, was listening, whose heart the Lord opened to pay attention to the things being said by Paul.

title: Acts 16:15
content: 15 And when she was baptized, and her household, she urged us, saying, “If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, entering into my house, stay.” And she persuaded us.

title: Acts 16:16
content: 16 And it happened that as we were going to the place of prayer, a certain young female slave having a Python spirit met us, who, divining, was bringing much gain to her masters.

title: Acts 16:17
content: 17 She, following after Paul and us, was shouting, saying, “These men are servants of the Most High God who are proclaiming to you the way of salvation.”

title: Acts 16:18
content: 18 And she was doing this for many days. But Paul, having become annoyed and having turned, said to the spirit, “I command you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out from her.” And it came out in the same hour.

title: Acts 16:19
content: 19 But her masters, seeing that their hope of profit had gone, seizing Paul and Silas, dragged them into the marketplace to the rulers.

title: Acts 16:20
content: 20 And having brought them to the magistrates, they said, “These men are greatly troubling our city, being Jews,

title: Acts 16:21
content: 21 and they are proclaiming customs that are lawful for us neither to accept nor to practice, being Romans.”

title: Acts 16:22
content: 22 And the crowd rose up together against them, and the magistrates, tearing off their garments, commanded them to be beaten with rods.

title: Acts 16:23
content: 23 And having laid many blows upon them, they threw them into prison, commanding the jailer to guard them securely,

title: Acts 16:24
content: 24 who, having received such a command, threw them into the inner prison and fastened their feet in the stocks.

title: Acts 16:25
content: 25 But around midnight, Paul and Silas, praying, were singing hymns to God, and the prisoners were listening to them.

title: Acts 16:26
content: 26 And suddenly a great earthquake happened, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken, and immediately all the doors were opened, and the chains of all were unfastened.

title: Acts 16:27
content: 27 But the jailer became awake, and seeing the prison doors having been opened, having drawn {his} sword, he was about to kill himself, thinking the prisoners to have escaped.

title: Acts 16:28
content: 28 But Paul shouted with a loud voice, saying, “Do not do harm to yourself, for we are all here.”

title: Acts 16:29
content: 29 So having called for lights, he rushed in and, being terrified, he fell down to Paul and Silas,

title: Acts 16:30
content: 30 and having brought them out, he said, “Sirs, what is necessary for me to do in order to be saved?”

title: Acts 16:31
content: 31 And they said, “Believe in the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved, you and your household.”

title: Acts 16:32
content: 32 And they spoke the word of the Lord to him, with everyone in his house.

title: Acts 16:33
content: 33 And taking them at that hour of the night, he washed them from the blows, and he was baptized immediately—he and all the ones of him.

title: Acts 16:34
content: 34 And bringing them up into {his} house, he set a table before them and rejoiced with {his} household, having believed in God.

title: Acts 16:35
content: 35 Now when day came, the magistrates sent officers, saying, “Release those men.”

title: Acts 16:36
content: 36 And the jailer reported the words to Paul, “The magistrates have sent that you may be released. Now therefore, coming out, go in peace.”

title: Acts 16:37
content: 37 But Paul said to them, “Having beaten us in public without trial, men being Romans, they threw us into prison, and now they cast us out secretly? For not! Instead, coming themselves, let them lead us out.”

title: Acts 16:38
content: 38 So the officers reported these words to the magistrates and they were terrified, hearing that they were Romans.

title: Acts 16:39
content: 39 And coming, they entreated them, and bringing them out, they were asking them to go away from the city.

title: Acts 16:40
content: 40 So going out from the prison, they came to Lydia. And seeing the brothers, they exhorted them and went out.

title: Acts 17:1
content: 1 Now passing through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where a synagogue of the Jews was.

title: Acts 17:2
content: 2 And according to the custom of Paul, he went to them, and on three Sabbaths he was reasoning with them from the Scriptures,

title: Acts 17:3
content: 3 fully opening them and demonstrating that it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead, and {saying}, “This Jesus, whom I proclaim to you, is the Christ.”

title: Acts 17:4
content: 4 And some from them were persuaded and were associated with Paul and Silas, both a large number of worshiping Greeks and not a few of the leading women.

title: Acts 17:5
content: 5 But the Jews, having become jealous, and having brought certain wicked men from the marketplace, and having gathered a crowd, they agitated the city. And attacking the house of Jason, they sought to lead them out to the people.

title: Acts 17:6
content: 6 But not having found them, they dragged Jason and certain brothers to the city officials, shouting, “The ones having turned the world upside down, they are also present here,

title: Acts 17:7
content: 7 whom Jason and all these men have welcomed. They are acting against the decrees of Caesar, saying there is another king, Jesus.”

title: Acts 17:8
content: 8 And they agitated the crowd and the city officials hearing these things.

title: Acts 17:9
content: 9 And having received a bond from Jason and the rest, they released them.

title: Acts 17:10
content: 10 But the brothers immediately sent away both Paul and Silas by night to Berea, who, having arrived, went into the synagogue of the Jews.

title: Acts 17:11
content: 11 Now these were more noble than {those} in Thessalonica, who received the word with all readiness, examining the Scriptures each day, whether these things might be so.

title: Acts 17:12
content: 12 Then indeed many of them believed, even influential Greek women and not a few men.

title: Acts 17:13
content: 13 But when the Jews from Thessalonica learned that the word of God was also being proclaimed by Paul at Berea, they came there also, exciting and troubling the crowds.

title: Acts 17:14
content: 14 So then the brothers immediately sent Paul away to go as far as to the sea, but both Silas and Timothy stayed there.

title: Acts 17:15
content: 15 But the ones conducting Paul brought him as far as Athens and, having received a command to Silas and Timothy that they should come to him as quickly as possible, they departed.

title: Acts 17:16
content: 16 Now while Paul was waiting for them in Athens, his spirit was being provoked within him, seeing the city being full of idols.

title: Acts 17:17
content: 17 So indeed he reasoned in the synagogue with the Jews and the ones worshiping and in the marketplace every day with the ones meeting him.

title: Acts 17:18
content: 18 But also some of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers were disputing with him. And some were saying, “What might this word-picker want to say?” But others {said}, “He seems to be a proclaimer of foreign gods,” because he was proclaiming Jesus and the resurrection.

title: Acts 17:19
content: 19 And taking hold of him, they brought him to the Areopagus, saying, “Are we able to know what this new teaching {is} that is being spoken by you?

title: Acts 17:20
content: 20 For you are bringing some startling things into our ears. Therefore, we wish to know what these things want to be.”

title: Acts 17:21
content: 21 (Now all the Athenians and the sojourning foreigners were devoting their leisure to nothing other than either to say something or to hear something newer.)

title: Acts 17:22
content: 22 And Paul, having been stood in the middle of the Areopagus, was saying, “Men, Athenians, I see how you are more religious in everything.

title: Acts 17:23
content: 23 For passing through and observing your objects of worship, I even found an altar on which had been inscribed, ‘To an Unknown God.’ What therefore you worship not knowing, this I announce to you.

title: Acts 17:24
content: 24 The God having made the world and everything in it, he, being Lord of heaven and earth, does not live in hand-built temples.

title: Acts 17:25
content: 25 Neither is he cared for by hands of men, needing anything, himself giving life and breath and all things to all.

title: Acts 17:26
content: 26 And from one he made every nation of men to live on all the face of the earth, having determined {their} appointed seasons and the boundaries of their habitation,

title: Acts 17:27
content: 27 to seek God, if perhaps they might feel around for him and find him, yet indeed not being far from each one of us.

title: Acts 17:28
content: 28 For ‘in him we live and are moved and are,’ and as some of your own poets have said, ‘For we too are {his} offspring.’

title: Acts 17:29
content: 29 Therefore, being offspring of God, we ought not to consider the Divine to be similar to gold or silver or stone—images of the skill and imagination of man.

title: Acts 17:30
content: 30 Therefore God, having indeed overlooked the times of ignorance, now to men commands everyone everywhere to repent,

title: Acts 17:31
content: 31 because he has set a day in which he is going to judge the world in righteousness by the man whom he has appointed, having provided assurance to all, having raised him from the dead.”

title: Acts 17:32
content: 32 Now hearing of the resurrection of the dead, some indeed mocked, but others said, “We will hear you also again concerning this.”

title: Acts 17:33
content: 33 So Paul went out from their midst.

title: Acts 17:34
content: 34 But certain men, being joined to him, believed, among whom {were} even Dionysius the Areopagite and a woman, Damaris by name, and others with them.

title: Acts 18:1
content: 1 After these things, having departed from Athens, he went to Corinth.

title: Acts 18:2
content: 2 And having found a certain Jew, Aquila by name, a Pontian by birth, having recently come from Italy, also Priscilla, his wife, because Claudius had ordered all the Jews to depart from Rome, he approached them,

title: Acts 18:3
content: 3 and because he was of the same trade, he stayed with them and was working, for they were tentmakers by trade.

title: Acts 18:4
content: 4 And he was reasoning in the synagogue on every Sabbath, persuading both Jews and Greeks.

title: Acts 18:5
content: 5 But when both Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia, Paul was constrained by the word, to the Jews solemnly attesting Jesus to be the Christ.

title: Acts 18:6
content: 6 But as they were opposing and insulting him, shaking out {his} garments, he said to them, “Your blood {be} upon your head! I am clean! From now on I will go to the Gentiles.”

title: Acts 18:7
content: 7 And having departed from there, he went into the house of a certain one worshiping God, Titius Justus by name, whose house was adjoining to the synagogue.

title: Acts 18:8
content: 8 But Crispus, the synagogue leader, believed in the Lord with his whole house, and many of the Corinthians, hearing, were believing and were being baptized.

title: Acts 18:9
content: 9 And the Lord said to Paul by a vision in the night, “Do not fear, but speak and do not be silent.

title: Acts 18:10
content: 10 For I am with you, and no one will set upon you to harm you, for much people is to me in this city.”

title: Acts 18:11
content: 11 So he stayed for a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.

title: Acts 18:12
content: 12 But when Gallio was governor of Achaia, the Jews rose up unanimously against Paul and brought him to the judgment seat,

title: Acts 18:13
content: 13 saying, “This one persuades men to worship God contrary to the law.”

title: Acts 18:14
content: 14 But when Paul was going to open {his} mouth, Gallio said to the Jews, “O Jews, if indeed it was some crime or evil wrongdoing, by reason I would have endured you,

title: Acts 18:15
content: 15 but if the questions {are} about word and names and your law, you will see yourselves. I do not want to be a judge of these things.”

title: Acts 18:16
content: 16 And he sent them away from the judgment seat.

title: Acts 18:17
content: 17 But having seized Sosthenes, the synagogue leader, they were all beating him before the judgment seat, and none of these things mattered to Gallio.

title: Acts 18:18
content: 18 But Paul, having stayed yet many days, leaving the brothers, sailed to Syria, Priscilla and Aquila also {being} with him, having shorn {his} head in Cenchrea, for he had a vow.

title: Acts 18:19
content: 19 And they came down to Ephesus and them he left there, but he himself, having gone into the synagogue, reasoned with the Jews.

title: Acts 18:20
content: 20 But when they asked him to stay for a longer time, he did not consent.

title: Acts 18:21
content: 21 But leaving them and saying, “I will return again to you, God being willing,” he put to sea from Ephesus.

title: Acts 18:22
content: 22 And having come down to Caesarea, having gone up and having greeted the church, he went down to Antioch.

title: Acts 18:23
content: 23 And having stayed some time, he departed, going through the region of Galatia and Phrygia in succession, strengthening all the disciples.

title: Acts 18:24
content: 24 Now a certain Jewish man, Apollos by name, an Alexandrian by birth, an eloquent man, came down to Ephesus, being mighty in the Scriptures.

title: Acts 18:25
content: 25 He had been taught the way of the Lord, and being fervent in spirit, he was speaking and teaching accurately the things concerning Jesus, knowing only the baptism of John.

title: Acts 18:26
content: 26 And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue, but hearing him, Priscilla and Aquila took him aside and explained to him the way of God more accurately.

title: Acts 18:27
content: 27 And when he desired to pass over into Achaia, the brothers, encouraging him, wrote to the disciples to welcome him, who, having arrived, greatly helped the ones having believed by grace.

title: Acts 18:28
content: 28 For he was powerfully refuting the Jews in public, showing Jesus to be the Christ by the Scriptures.

title: Acts 19:1
content: 1 And it happened that while Apollos was in Corinth, Paul, passing through the upper parts, came down to Ephesus and found certain disciples.

title: Acts 19:2
content: 2 And he said to them, “If you received the Holy Spirit, having believed?” But they said to him, “No, we have not even heard if there is a Holy Spirit.”

title: Acts 19:3
content: 3 And he said, “Into what then were you baptized?” And they said, “Into the baptism of John.”

title: Acts 19:4
content: 4 But Paul replied, “John baptized a baptism of repentance, saying to the people that they should believe in the one coming after him, that is, in Jesus.”

title: Acts 19:5
content: 5 And having heard this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

title: Acts 19:6
content: 6 And Paul having laid hands on them, the Holy Spirit came upon them and they were speaking in languages and prophesying.

title: Acts 19:7
content: 7 And they all were about 12 men.

title: Acts 19:8
content: 8 And going into the synagogue, he was speaking boldly for three months, reasoning and persuading about the kingdom of God.

title: Acts 19:9
content: 9 But when some were being hardened and disobeying, speaking evil of the Way before the multitude, departing from them, he separated the disciples, reasoning each day in the school of Tyrannus.

title: Acts 19:10
content: 10 And this happened for two years, so that all living in Asia heard the word of the Lord, both Jews and Greeks.

title: Acts 19:11
content: 11 And God was doing not ordinary miracles by the hands of Paul,

title: Acts 19:12
content: 12 so that even handkerchiefs or aprons from his skin were taken to the sick and {their} illnesses departed from them, and the evil spirits came out.

title: Acts 19:13
content: 13 Now some of the traveling Jewish exorcists also tried to invoke the name of the Lord Jesus over the ones having evil spirits, saying, “I adjure you by the Jesus whom Paul proclaims.”

title: Acts 19:14
content: 14 (Now seven sons of Sceva, a certain Jewish chief priest, were doing this.)

title: Acts 19:15
content: 15 But answering, the evil spirit said to them, “Jesus I acknowledge, and Paul I know, but you, who are you?”

title: Acts 19:16
content: 16 And the man in whom was the evil spirit, leaping on them, overpowering them both, prevailed against them, so that they fled from that house naked and wounded.

title: Acts 19:17
content: 17 And this became known to all living in Ephesus, both Jews and Greeks. And fear fell upon them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was being magnified.

title: Acts 19:18
content: 18 And many of the ones having believed were coming, confessing and declaring their deeds.

title: Acts 19:19
content: 19 And many of the ones practicing the magical arts, bringing together {their} books, were burning them before everyone. And they calculated the value of them, and they found {it to be} five myriad pieces of silver.

title: Acts 19:20
content: 20 So with power the word of the Lord was increasing and prevailing.

title: Acts 19:21
content: 21 Now when these things were fulfilled, Paul determined in the Spirit to travel to Jerusalem, passing through Macedonia and Achaia, saying, “After I have been there, it is necessary for me also to see Rome.”

title: Acts 19:22
content: 22 And sending to Macedonia two of the ones helping him, Timothy and Erastus, he himself stayed in Asia for a time.

title: Acts 19:23
content: 23 But at that time, no small disturbance happened concerning the Way.

title: Acts 19:24
content: 24 For a certain silversmith making silver shrines of Artemis, Demetrius by name, was bringing not a little business to the craftsmen,

title: Acts 19:25
content: 25 whom, having gathered together, and the workers about such things, said, “Men, you know that our prosperity is from this business.

title: Acts 19:26
content: 26 And you see and hear that not only in Ephesus but in almost all of Asia this Paul, having persuaded, has removed a considerable crowd, saying that the things coming into being through hands are not gods.

title: Acts 19:27
content: 27 And not only is this in peril, our trade to come to disrepute, but even the temple of the great goddess Artemis to be considered as nothing. And indeed, her majesty is about to be destroyed, whom all Asia, indeed the world, worships.”

title: Acts 19:28
content: 28 And hearing this and becoming full of anger, they were shouting, saying, “Great {is} Artemis of the Ephesians.”

title: Acts 19:29
content: 29 And the city was filled with confusion, and they rushed unanimously into the theater, having seized Gaius and Aristarchus, Macedonians, travel companions of Paul.

title: Acts 19:30
content: 30 But when Paul was desiring to enter among the people, the disciples were not permitting him.

title: Acts 19:31
content: 31 And also some of the Asiarchs, being friends to him, sending to him, were urging him not to give himself into the theater.

title: Acts 19:32
content: 32 Then indeed different ones were shouting something different, for the assembly was confused, and the majority did not know for what reason they had come together.

title: Acts 19:33
content: 33 And {some} from the crowd instructed Alexander, the Jews having pushed him forward, and Alexander, waving {his} hand, was wanting to give a defense to the people.

title: Acts 19:34
content: 34 But recognizing that he was a Jew, one voice happened from {them} all, while shouting for two hours, “Great {is} Artemis of the Ephesians.”

title: Acts 19:35
content: 35 But quieting the crowd, the city clerk says, “Men, Ephesians, for who is there of men who does not know the Ephesian city to be the temple keeper of the great Artemis and of the Zeus-fallen image?

title: Acts 19:36
content: 36 These things, then, being undeniable, it is necessary for you to be calmed and to do nothing rash.

title: Acts 19:37
content: 37 For you brought these men {who are} neither temple-robbers nor blasphemers of our goddess.

title: Acts 19:38
